Newton's First Law states that an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by an external force. This is also known as the law of inertia. Force equals mass times acceleration, written as F = ma. Momentum is defined as mass times velocity, or p = mv. Kinetic energy equals one half mass times velocity squared: KE = 0.5 * m * v^2.
